position.marginalia_text: motus, gradibus (, vt supra) +++ terminari debere. Dierum aute[m] erit summa suis coniunctoru[m] horis XXXVI. Cribrationes vero, id est reiterationes septimo clauduntur numero. Vnde omnibus simul comprehensis, et aggregatis pariterq[ue] cum reiterationibus iunctis, dies erunt CCLII.

marginalia.translation: motion, degrees (as above) +++ to ought to be concluded. The days and hours added together amount to 36 days. It is in the septenary number, that is, all the reiterations, are perfected. And the days are 252.

position.marginalia_text: De Carbonu[m] pro operis compleme[n]to quantitate. Sed ne quidpia[m] omittere videamur, quonia[m] vt secundo Coeli et mundi inquit Philosophus, Parvus error in principio, Maximus est in fine: Propterea et de Carbonu[m] qua[n]titate differendu[m] esse ce[n]svimus, sine quibus prorsus aliquid recte agere no[n] videtur Artifex. Summa igitur Carbonu[m] o[mn]ium, a diebus tribus pro ipso[rum] Corba, qua[e] venetijs est eoru[m] in vsu, mensura erit corbaru[m] LXXXIIII. Et Medicina Libras co[m]prehendet LXIIII, Ac ip[s]ius prorectionis, vna supra centum.

marginalia.translation: On the quantity of coals for the completion of the work A small error at the beginning is very large at the end. With respect to the quantity of coals, we therefore recommend that it is to be differentiated, without which the artificer does not seem to be working entirely correctly. The sum total of charcoals required is therefore 84 baskets according to measure, for which purpose we use the Venetian measures. And one part is projected onto 10 parts.

position.marginalia_text: De Medicina[e] reiteratione A reiterationibus aute[m] Medicina[e], vna cadet supra 1000.10000.100000.1000000.1000000.10000000. Nec non finaliter, vna supra inco[m]prehensibile[m] numeru[m] Vnde p[er] secuta cuncta Laudetur trinus et vnus ineffabilis Deus: qui tanta[m] nobis et tibi (gratis) ad misericordia[m] largitus est gratiam.

marginalia.translation: On the reiteration of medicine From the reiterations of medicine, one falls above 1000.10000.100000.1000000.1000000.10000000. And not not finally one above an incomprehensible number, From here through all the following, the princile of three and one ineffable God shall be praised, who with his immense goodness will be praised by us and you.
